intro: Kibessia galeata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in cool, humid climates. Kibessia galeata is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
